definition: to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)
to flow/to disseminate/to circulate or spread/to move or drift/to degenerate/to banish or send into exile/stream of water or sth resembling one/class, rate or grade

sentences.english: His poetic achievement stands at the center of modern literature.
sentences.chinese: 他是最优秀的英文诗人之一，是现代文学的中流砥柱。

sentences.english: UN Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon described the queen as an anchor for our age.
sentences.chinese: 联合国秘书长潘基文称女王为这个时代的中流砥柱。

sentences.english: Historically, conscription was the mainstay of PLA recruitment.
sentences.chinese: 历史上，义务兵一直是解放军的中流砥柱。

sentences.english: The Compton brothers were mainstays of the Arsenal side in the 1940s.
sentences.chinese: 坎普顿兄弟是阿森纳40年代的中流砥柱。

sentences.english: America is still and always will be the bastion for Freedomand Democracy.
sentences.chinese: 美国迄今并永远是自由和民主的中流砥柱。

sentences.english: In sub-Saharan Africa, women are also the backbone of the agricultural sector.
sentences.chinese: 在撒哈拉以南非洲，妇女通常是农业部门的中流砥柱。

sentences.english: The five engineers of real learning are the mainstays of the small factory.
sentences.chinese: 那五位具有真才实学的工程师是这个小厂的中流砥柱。

sentences.english: Both are mainstays of the Wenzhou economy.
sentences.chinese: 这两个都是温州经济的中流砥柱。

definition: an up-and-coming youngster/new talent/a brilliant younger generation
another name for 金箍棒[jin1 gu1 bang4]/(fig.) stabilizing force
spiritual leader (of a nation or church)/religious leader
to be unwilling to pass on one's responsibilities to others
to assume personal responsibility (idiom); to take charge of a section
to rise abruptly (to a towering position)/to tower over/to spring up/to emerge suddenly/the emergence (e.g. of a power)
half of the country (esp. when half the country has fallen into enemy hands)/vast swathe of territory
